column1:
Little_Miss_Brick,"2015-11-18T11:21:30.42Z","Emma helps a Hedgehog","

Help Emma Help injured animals with this Vet Ambulance! You can help Emma speed to the rescue in this very small ambulance which is open top for easy play access.
column2: This set is intended to be a add-on to the Vet Clinic from the LEGO Friends Vet subtheme from the 2015 release.&nbsp

column1: The box is a standard size for a $10/£
column2: 10 set however with only 89 pieces some might suggest that it is borderline polybag territory and I would have to agree. The instructions are easy to follow.&nbsp
s surprising when built that this set actually has 89 pieces as it looks a lot smaller than what you would expect 89 pieces to be. The parts are&nbsp
column3: not terribly unique. The mold used for the Hedgehog does look different from the Polybag versions and Magazine version however I am yet to obtain those sets to be sure.

column1: Other pieces include, the Milk/Water bottle, 1 x 2 printed Vet Ambulance piece (Magenta Cross), Medium Azure Brick Bow Arch and Medium Azure Wheel Arch.
This comes with Emma in her Vet outfit. The torso comes in the Vet Clinic on Mia'
column2: s minidoll but no other sets at this stage. The Sand Green skirt comes in a number of other sets from the Jungle Rescue range but also the mini golf polybag.&nbsp

column1: The build only took around 5 mins and there is not much to it, the instructions are easy to follow and with only 89 pieces you are not endlessly looking for pieces. I do not feel the building experience is what you are buying this set for, it is a simple additional set to go with the Vet Clinic.

The final model for me looks good and the colours are in keeping with LEGO Friends sets, the only reservation I have is the size, I feel the ambulance could have been a little bigger, perhaps the size of one of the LEGO Friends cars. It doesn'
column2: t disappoint overall but also the cost is quite high for the piece count.&nbsp

t buy it unless you have the Vet Clinic, the set by itself does not offer much but as an additional item with the Vet Clinic I think it is worth purchasing this set. I personally picked this up over half price off in a local Tesco Supermarket in the UK but had it been full price I would not have purchased it.&nbsp
